message: Someone recently recommended userena to me for site registration as an alternative to django-registration

I have been playing with it for a few nights and I do like it, but I do see some challenges in migrating it into an exsisting project using django-registration. I have a site that has 12,000 registered users. Im curious if anyone has used userena. How were your experiences? Did anyone introduce it into an exsisting project?

One of the most popular user-registration apps is django-registration. It has several hundred forks and a lot of possibilities for use. The reasons for the forks are mainly becuase the root does not do everything that everyone wants it to do. This is actually the beauty of open source right. You can take same that someone else has done and turn it into something useful for you. Then if its truly open-source your changes could be used by someone else and the cloning continues. Use at your own risk though, serously! Ok so whats my point with this diatribe.
12k users using userena, no problems at all.
